symptoms: dyspnea with normal pulmonary function tests

diagnoses: description: A rare, life-threatening condition that can occur in people who take certain medications, such as antipsychotics. Symptoms include fever, muscle stiffness, tremor, confusion, and altered mental state. NMS can also cause autonomic instability, leading to irregular heartbeat, sweating, and fluctuations in blood pressure. In severe cases, NMS can be fatal.

treatment: Treatment for NMS includes stopping the medication that is causing the condition, and providing supportive care, such as intravenous fluids and medication to control symptoms. In severe cases, people with NMS may need to be admitted to the intensive care unit for close monitoring and treatment.

description: A bacterial infection that is spread by ticks. Symptoms include fever, headache, fatigue, and a characteristic rash called erythema migrans. If left untreated, Lyme disease can spread to the joints, heart, and nervous system.

treatment: Treatment for Lyme disease includes antibiotics. In most cases, Lyme disease can be cured with antibiotics. However, if the infection is not treated early, it can lead to serious complications.

description: A chronic pain disorder that is characterized by widespread musculoskeletal pain, fatigue, and sleep problems. People with fibromyalgia may also experience other symptoms, such as headaches, irritable bowel syndrome, and depression.
treatment: There is no cure for fibromyalgia, but there are treatments that can help manage the symptoms. Treatment options include medication, physical therapy, and cognitive-behavioral therapy.

description: A condition in which the thyroid gland does not produce enough thyroid hormone. Symptoms include fatigue, weight gain, cold intolerance, and dry skin. Hypothyroidism can also cause depression, anxiety, and memory problems.

treatment: Treatment for hypothyroidism includes taking thyroid hormone medication. In most cases, hypothyroidism can be managed with medication. However, if the condition is left untreated, it can lead to serious complications, such as heart problems and infertility.

description: A condition that occurs when the body does not have enough fluids. Symptoms include thirst, dizziness, headache, and fatigue. In severe cases, dehydration can lead to kidney failure and even death.

treatment: Treatment for dehydration includes drinking fluids and, in severe cases, intravenous fluids. In most cases, dehydration can be treated with oral fluids. However, if the condition is severe, people with dehydration may need to be admitted to the hospital for intravenous fluids.

description: A condition in which the body does not have enough iron. Iron is needed to make red blood cells, which carry oxygen throughout the body. Symptoms of iron deficiency anemia include fatigue, weakness, shortness of breath, and pale skin. Iron deficiency anemia can also cause hair loss and brittle nails.

treatment: Treatment for iron deficiency anemia includes taking iron supplements. In most cases, iron deficiency anemia can be treated with oral iron supplements. However, if the condition is severe, people with iron deficiency anemia may need to receive iron injections.

description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that produce tears and saliva. Symptoms include dry eyes, dry mouth, and fatigue. Sjögrens syndrome can also cause joint pain, skin problems, and other symptoms.

treatment: There is no cure for Sjögrens syndrome, but there are treatments that can help manage the symptoms. Treatment options include artificial tears, saliva substitutes, and medications to suppress the immune system.

description: An autoimmune disease that causes inflammation of the joints. Symptoms include joint pain, swelling, and stiffness. Rheumatoid arthritis can also cause fatigue, fever, and weight loss. In severe cases, rheumatoid arthritis can lead to joint damage and disability.

treatment: Treatment for rheumatoid arthritis includes medication, physical therapy, and surgery. Medication can help reduce inflammation and pain, while physical therapy can help improve joint flexibility and strength. Surgery may be necessary to repair damaged joints.

description: An autoimmune disease that can affect many parts of the body, including the skin, joints, kidneys, and brain. Symptoms include fatigue, joint pain, skin rash, and hair loss. Lupus can also cause fever, weight loss, and other symptoms.

treatment: Treatment for lupus includes medication, physical therapy, and lifestyle changes. Medication can help reduce inflammation and pain, while physical therapy can help improve joint flexibility and strength. Lifestyle changes, such as getting enough rest and avoiding stress, can also help manage the symptoms of lupus.

description: An autoimmune disease that attacks the glands that produce tears and saliva. Symptoms include dry eyes, dry mouth, and fatigue. Sjögrens syndrome can also cause joint pain, skin problems, and other symptoms.

treatment: There is no cure for Sjögrens syndrome, but there are treatments that can help manage the symptoms. Treatment options include artificial tears, saliva substitutes, and medications to suppress the immune system.

risk factors: The cause of Sjögrens syndrome is unknown, but it is thought to be related to a combination of genetic and environmental factors. Risk factors include being female, having a family history of autoimmune diseases, and being exposed to certain viruses or toxins.
